thread.title: Angola: AIA Boss Defends Measures for Economic Growth
thread.title_full: Angola: AIA Boss Defends Measures for Economic Growth

title: Angola: AIA Boss Defends Measures for Economic Growth
text:
Zimbabwe: Moyo's Daughter Struggled With Depression Luanda — The chairman of the Angolan Industrial Association (AIA), José Severino, defended on Thursday the country's need to continue to grow, despite low oil prices at the international market. José Severino, who was speaking to the press after hearing at the National Assembly a message from the Angolan Head of State on the state of the nation, said this growth aims, among others, to overcome the competitiveness deficit. He said that it was the competitiveness deficit on other member states of the Southern Africa Development Community (SADC), the regional organization of which Angola is a founding member. According to him, the country needs to grow at a rate of 3.5 percent per year. "That's what we wish to the Executive". In that context, he considered essential to work more with civil society, trade unions and business associations, with a view to greater social cohesion. Angola
